column4: Your best bet is to try a Live CD of Maverick and see if it works.
I will (Windows XP is installing on the machine at this very moment, so I can't), but that won't tell me if the proprietary driver works because it's not loaded on the live CD
I'm not even sure if a decent nvidia driver is on the live CD. I seem to remember getting a crappy resolution when I ran the Lucid CD, though I may be remembering wrong
2 friends of mine both have Nvidia cards (IDK model) Prop drivers & FOSS worked fine in Maverick.
